reviews.text: There's so much to do in the beautiful city of  Sienna. The historical references and stories of this city is amazing and so is the primary Piazzas. Shopping is wonderful the food is amazing (all Italian foods are). The city is clean, most of the merchants 90% speak English and 2 other languages. The leather, clothing and other mechanize is very high level. Service is amazing and the smiles are even better. The Cathedral is amazing as the marble and other materials came from areas of Italy and there are many famous sculptures were for hire here in Sienna. An amazing spiritual structure a great story which solidified the city of Sienna.

Breathtaking cathedral located in central Florence. Quite a popular attraction, so I'd recommend to arrive early to 100m long queue at the main entry. They are currently midway through cleaning the cathedral so there's some scaffolding blocking certain parts of the exterior, but still plenty of great photos to be had.

Are you Ready to be amazed once You will arrive in Florence Santa Maria Novella? 

Take a while... Just breathe...

You will take some time to realize that you are inside such beauty.

Clean and elegant place... culture, history and ART. 

There are few art places in the Planet that will Give you a similar knockout...  be prepared!

There are some interesting reviews here saying that you have to pay to go inside, but I've never paid for it (only if you want to go to the museum, tower or baptistery then you have to pay). Other reviews giving 1 star because of the queue, they simply don't care about the history of the place or the architecture.
I give 5 stars because from every angle that I see the cathedral, I fell stunning.

Unique architectonic style, excellent example of Italian tradition of catholic temples, it is an overwhelming experience beholding the dome paintings. It is also incredible the sight from the top of the dome, it is possible to see every corner of Florence; if one has a heart affection it is not recommendable ascending to the top since it is a demanding exercise and some suffer a heart arrest; but it is an extraordinary experience visiting this beautiful cathedral.
The ceiling is amazing. Looks much smaller inside than out. There Is a lot of scaffolding up at the moment around the walls for restoration work but still a remarkable place well worth a visit

It's the baptismal hall right next to Duumo. It is the baptismal hall, which has the so-called Gate of Heaven. Because there are many people in Duomo, you can visit it in the early hours and enjoy a very comfortable view of the interior. There are parts that don't feel like pictures, so it's a good idea to go in and look around. 
There are also a lot of vendors around. If you don't need anything, you'd better avoid it.
Beautiful building that we only ended up visiting because it was included in the 18€ ticket. It was under renovation while we were there, but what we could see was a nice addition to our day.
More than the guilded doors, I marvelled at the frescos and the strategically placed windows to making the geometric space a photo-op any time of the day
A very popular place for a reason, the history and architecture is amazing.

One of the best museum. Full of the world's masterpieces. Lay people with some little interest in history and art can enjoy their time. Beauty is for everyone. BTW knowing of a short history or taking guided tour can improve your experience even more. Better reserve the ticket beforehand and the fast pass as well to only spend more time and energy admiring the art. Gonna be a long day here but it's worth it.

The gallery is a very special place, packed with full sized original paintings of all your favourite Christmas cards!  Every new room reveals yet more beautiful treasures.  It really is a must to visit - but be sure to buy your ticket online and print it out and take with you, to avoid the long entrance queues.

One of the most beautiful art museums I have ever been to — and I’ve traveled a ton and live in NYC! The collections of Renaissance art are incredible. I highly recommend the Florence pass for this (buy at a tourist info center - 72€ for 72 hrs into every major site in Florence), which will quickly pay for itself when you start adding up admission costs. The Uffizi Gallery alone has a pretty steep admission cost so it’s definitely worth getting the pass! Plan at least 1.5-2 hours here. The audio guide was great for pointing out all the highlights.

Hire a guide, to explain you the symbolism n significance of the paintings.. otherwise they'll all look the same to you. Esp to anyone who doesn't know much about art and history... a good guide will make this experience unforgettable!

The Uffizi Gallery is stunning and my favorite memory of visiting Florence Italy. I don't recall the price, so please forgive me, but I can say with certainty that the experience is worth every penny.
The amount of art is almost daunting, each hallway and room being filled with at least half a dozen priceless pieces; but the ceilings and the walls are decorated too and I found myself looking up at the ceilings nearly as often as I was looking at the art.
I was also ecstatic to see Botticelli's masterpieces in person, as they are a few of my favorite pieces.
If you're an art or history fan, this is a MUST SEE

A train stop in Florence was an unexpected surprise in Florence as we were able to see Michelangelo's David statue. It's truly breath taking and has plenty of details to keep your interest piqued for a large amount of time. There are other Michelangelo statues present as well and some plasters by other famous Italian sculptors. Make an effort to go to the Galleria and you won't be disappointed.

Come early - when it opens if you can. It opens earlier than most every other museum and major tourist site in Florence, so it’s definitely worth starting your day here and beating the crowds. We got there at 8:30 when it opened and took our time exploring the gallery. By 9:30/10:00 when we left, it was packed with tour groups, school groups, and every tourist in the city. The David is incredible in person. An absolute do not miss in Florence.

A must visit when in Florence. Expect a long wait outside if you do not make a reservation to get in. Reservation online are more expensive than a standard ticket, but the line looks like it was over an hour wait while reserved can walk in almost anytime during your reserved time. The art work and sculptures are definitely worth seeing. Gallery is smaller than we originally thought, whole visit could be soaked in within an hour.

The statue of David is astounding in person. They also have a music museum currently. The piano was created in Florence and they have what is believed to be the first upright piano on display currently as part of a music exhibit. They have several other pieces worth seeing. We went during the free week but would have preferred to pay as it was much busier than during paid weeks and you cannot make reservations during a free week. Please like the review if it was helpful or ask questions and hopefully I will be able to answer them.

The paintings are amazing. There is an impressive collection of sculptures and when you enter this particular room it's a different atmosphere. Of course, Michelangelo's David blows your mind. I can't even put to words. 
And, if like me, you like music, the museum of musical instruments cannot be missed!

This place was an amazing surprise in how awesome it was! What an incredible museum with displays of actual instruments used throughout the centuries advancing science and knowledge of the universe.... and only cost 10 euros admission. Do see and be amazed. Highly recommend.

Great science museum. Unique exhibits and some very curious ones in the medical area. Spent several worthwhile hours and enjoyed every minute. Be sure to download the interactive app. Very informative and well written descriptions with excellent photos and drawings as well. Best museum app I have used. I still have it on my phone after 3 months and have gone back to it to read some of the entries again.

The museum is nice, kind & friendly staff, and filled with interesting artifacts. Descriptions were in both Italian and English, and considering it is one of few places open on Monday, it wasn't overly crowded. However, we were a bit disappointed as, after reading on the website that it was a child-friendly place, that there was only a small part at the exit which was interactive for children (and truly geared toward older childern/teens). Worth a visit if you're interested in Galileo, but be advised if you have small children.

I loved it! Very rare collections of various inventions of Galileo from various fields - chemistry, astronomy, physics. Going to the museum was a big fun & it is very well organised, too! It's a must see for every one who likes science and inventions. Ticket price: around 10€ per person.

This is a hidden gem of Pisa. Easy to navigate, great displays. English friendly. Well worth the 10e entrance fee. Weird thing here: the mummified middle and pointer fingers of Galileo himself! Loved the physics exhibit on the second floor. For those who are science buffs, their collection of medical, astronomical, chemistry and physics instruments is worth the trip.

Love it!!! It's very romantic place when you can enjoy at beautiful moments .... Perfect to walk in a sunny afternoon... Drinking some wine..  or eat some cheese and ham...this landscape seems like a famous paint.. in really life... I'm recommend you visit this place always!!!!!

This place is awesome! Beautiful scenic spots for picture taking or just sitting and taking in the view. Many interesting shops, free street entertainment and museums nearby. Don't miss it when in Florence!
This bridge is crowded with tourists. You can have nice photos nearby. The bridge is full of brands and the area is surrounded by many shops. Good place to have tourist vibes and shopping too.

Always fun. Recently learned that Ponte Vecchio was the only bridge that survived the war. The other bridges along that stretch of river are rather utilitarian. Now I understand it. I can only imagine what it might have been like had the other bridges survived and kept their original character.

I've had an opportunity to row in a single under The Old Bridge. One of the most enjoyable rows I've ever had. The biggest crowd ever, for sure. No motor boats are allowed on this stretch of Arno river, so if in a rowing boat try not to flip over...and wear a life vest.

Immense queues for 90 minutes, to spend 20 minutes in there. The art & adjuatments for perspective in the dome itself are truly the work of genius. They could easily let more people in at once though. The queue is outrageous.
One of the most beautiful places to visit. Right before sunset and after. The atmosphere around the building is captivating. A must see in Florence

This is stunning, regardless of how often I visit. I highly recommend walking around the area, and particularly from here towards the Duomo. The Arno river is also a short walk from here. Stop awhile in the grounds out the front, and just enjoy being in one of the most picturesque places on earth.

Being here in one of the world famous places is a very special feeling
Italy.. Florence, basilica di Santa Maria is extremely beautiful and represent the exact image of the art and fineness of that wonderful era in the history of mankind!!
Beautiful place. Church and cemetery. Also there is absolutely fantastic view to the city

Just gorgeous! After the dark middle age, it's great to see how Renaissance thrills even in the churches and Basilicas. From Medici to Donatello, you must definitely visit it before you leave Florence.
What can I say? It’s beautiful. If you love history go here. Difficult to explain but it really stirs the soul and centres you. Simply wonderful.

In the heart of the city is the last residence of the De Medici family, where Lorenzo lie with his loved brother in the same tomb after a full time life, were Donatello sleeps continuing to supervise his creations from the bottom of the Basilica. If you are going to visit Florence this is a place you should visit. The  rest at last for the De Medici is situated in to the heart of the historical center, after visiting the city take your time to pay homage to the Lords of Florence and to one of the greatest politician of the history Lorenzo De Medici. I suggest to visit the complex as a final piece before leaving to fully appreciate the tour

Don't bother unless it's raining. Half of the place was closed 
(Library and chapel) and the ticket office (woman on desk) failed to make that clear. Easily mis-sold.

The tombs were ok, but you could not get anywhere near them.
It's a museum with a library and gardens. Has a lot of precious art. Doesn't look very interest g from outside but is very beautiful, definitely worth visit .
This is a beautiful place in a wonderful city. I really love Florence and not only because I love assassins creed.
Important place for Florence..too bad it's so tense with the armed guards, we all know who to thank for that..
Very beautiful, a different style of architecture not seen easily, greatly painted from the inside.

Gorgeous historical synagogue and nice grounds. Very large interior, with beautiful ceilings and windows and so on. There's a decent array of items and history on display in the museum. There's also a room upstairs with a 20 minute video looping (unfortunately it's presented in a random room with minimal seating) that provides some interesting additional history about the synagogue and the community.

And it has a great gift shop.
Impressive synagogue that’s worth a visit, go upstairs to the Women Gallery to get a great perspective on the space. There’s a kosher restaurant right next to it called Ruth’s.

Beautiful church. Super interesting graveyard. Old. Great gift store with handmade items supporting the monks.Great views of Florence from here. And a nice ride up to here through neighborhoods. Interesting countryside and large homes. Walk back to main Florence in 20 min on a path that is downhill. That was so nice!

Beautiful monastery with wonderful artwork. The restoration of the wall paintings is very interesting. Great views over the city of Florence from the main entrance and courtyard. Only a short walk from the Piazzale Michelangelo and well worth it! The cemetery is also very interesting.

If you go further up from the Michelangelo Plaza you can find this cathedral which has an amazing view of Florence. Don't get confused with the cathedral below this one. Climb up until you find the second cathedral which is San Miniato Al Monte.
Beautiful place. The church is a perfect example of Tuscan Roman architecture. There is also a cemetery  - not to be missed! And the view on Florence is breathtakig.

A bus stop right out front makes getting to this gem easy to get to. There are a decent amount of stairs, but very much worth the walk up. This is a good place to go to first and then walk down the hill to the Plaza Michelangelo.

It is free to enter. There was some construction/repair at my time of visit, but it was still quiet and cool. There is a small tomb in the lower levels that captures the old feel of the city. 

I would highly recommend a visit.

One of the best museum. Full of the world's masterpieces. Lay people with some little interest in history and art can enjoy their time. Beauty is for everyone. BTW knowing of a short history or taking guided tour can improve your experience even more. Better reserve the ticket beforehand and the fast pass as well to only spend more time and energy admiring the art. Gonna be a long day here but it's worth it.

The gallery is a very special place, packed with full sized original paintings of all your favourite Christmas cards!  Every new room reveals yet more beautiful treasures.  It really is a must to visit - but be sure to buy your ticket online and print it out and take with you, to avoid the long entrance queues.

One of the most beautiful art museums I have ever been to — and I’ve traveled a ton and live in NYC! The collections of Renaissance art are incredible. I highly recommend the Florence pass for this (buy at a tourist info center - 72€ for 72 hrs into every major site in Florence), which will quickly pay for itself when you start adding up admission costs. The Uffizi Gallery alone has a pretty steep admission cost so it’s definitely worth getting the pass! Plan at least 1.5-2 hours here. The audio guide was great for pointing out all the highlights.

Hire a guide, to explain you the symbolism n significance of the paintings.. otherwise they'll all look the same to you. Esp to anyone who doesn't know much about art and history... a good guide will make this experience unforgettable!

The Uffizi Gallery is stunning and my favorite memory of visiting Florence Italy. I don't recall the price, so please forgive me, but I can say with certainty that the experience is worth every penny.
The amount of art is almost daunting, each hallway and room being filled with at least half a dozen priceless pieces; but the ceilings and the walls are decorated too and I found myself looking up at the ceilings nearly as often as I was looking at the art.
I was also ecstatic to see Botticelli's masterpieces in person, as they are a few of my favorite pieces.
If you're an art or history fan, this is a MUST SEE

Ci ho mangiato due o tre volte. Fanno piadine espresse. Il cibo è discreto, il prezzo non particolarmente economico. Il saper soddisfare la clientela non è proprio il punto di forza del personale. Non mangiando carne e affettati ho sempre chiesto una piccola variante a una delle piadine offerte che consisteva nel sostituire il prosciutto con delle fette di melanzane o zucchine. L'ultima volta la tizia al bancone mi ha detto che non si possono cambiare le combinazioni proposte. Penosi. Cliente perso. A pochi passi, dall'altro lato del mercato, ci sono le ottime focaccine del Bondi. E loro te le fanno come vuoi senza discutere.

Ore 13. Affamati sì ma anche intenzionati a non spendere una "cifra" incocciamo per caso in questa piadineria nel centro di Firenze. Locale forse un po' sacrificato, ma piadine davvero ottime e proprietari gentilissimi. Rapporto qualità prezzo notevole. Raccomandato.

Circondati da trattorie carissime, ci ha salvato in pieno agosto, sotto un sole cocente e con tantissima fame: un 'isola felice. Preparano le piadine al momento, tutto artigianale, buon prezzo e ottimi ingredienti. Da non perdere!
Carino. Piadine fatte a regola d'arte in pieno stile romagnolo con anche grande varietà di farciture.
I titolari sono molto attenti agli ingredienti e alla varietà dell' offerta, il miglior posto dove mangiare una piadina a Firenze.

Wonderful little sandwich shop that is quick and affordable. The staff were great and their menu is easily laid out in Italian and English. We ordered a number one and number three with some wine as well. The sandwiches were great and I wish I had time for more! 

This is another gem of Florence that can be enjoyed easily if you're out sightseeing or need a quick lunch.

Don’t blink or you might miss it. This is a great spot to stop for lunch while sightseeing. It’s quick, easy, and incredible. Most sandwiches were around four Euro. The bread was incredible, I would recommend the salami with cream cheese. If you ask, they will tell you which ones are the most popular.
The best sandwich and glass of wine. Circa 1875. I think they have a solid plan. This is a must stop in Florence.
THE place to grab a €4 sandwich that is hot and fresh and delizioso!! (+ pick up a €2 glass of wine) The best street food and deal in Firenze. I come here multiple times every visit.

Absolutely delicious!  Don't miss this little hole in the wall place as their sandwiches are very good and the wine is tasty.  Everything was cheap and fast.  We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Everything is to-go and you eat on the street next to the counter.

Come before noon!! We got there ten minutes before they “opened” and the restaurant was already packed. It’s worth the wait!! It is a tiny restaurant and you more than likely will eat with others at your table but it is SO good! Every single thing we ate was fresh and the best we had while in Italy!!

We were lucky enough to find a place without having to queue. The place is famous for meat but we decided to give a lighter touch as we both weren't that hungry. I had pasta in beef sauce and it was just too good. Wife had Ribbolita soup (must try). I will definitely go again

If you come to Florence, please make sure you have Florence famous steak at this place. It's one of the best in the city. They also have different kinds of pasta with amazing flavors. 
Loved the food at this place 👍!!!

The beef was chewy, fatty and full of tendons. None of us could enjoy the main course. Instead of a good taste, we left with our jaws hurting. The sides of roasted potato and green salad were good, but that's about it. In fact, they didn't even bother to show us the cut of the beef before cooking. Really disappointed.

Very fun place to be. Once your inside (which can take a bit as they won't take reservations) it's like a different world. Very crowded, loud, busy and fun. You'll be seated on community tables and it look us only a few minutes to start conversations with totally strangers. The food is typical Tuscan cuisine, nothing special but hearty and good.
The best in Florence

I gave the store 5 stars for the friendliness and attentiveness of Staff. Had my leather jacket altered and it was done right away, for free. I didn't check the price compared to other stores but the leather jacket I got was very soft.

The beautiful leather goods and attention to detail in this shop was incredible! They personalize most item right in front of you, so you get an experience like no other and a beautiful leather good to show for it! Don't even get me started on the purses. They were all to die for! I'll be going back time I'm in Florence!
The best leather store in Florence 👌 various kinds of leather' products with different models. The staff are helpful and friendly.
Great staff, very helpful. Priced very reasonably for authentic leather. Located very centrally. Would recommend if you’re looking for authentic leather products.
One of the best neapolitan pizza in florence. Nice sitting places where you can sit with the kids.  EDIT!!!! NOW PERMANENTLY CLOSED REPLACED BY SOME LOUSY GROOVE PIZZA

This place has a friendly atmosphere with a bunch of tasty foods. The pizza guys are ready to show off their artworks whenever you give them the green light.  The music is festive which makes you want  to try out new things.

The pizzas we ordered were delightful and tasty. Also all the ingredients were fresh. In particular the classic Bruschetta with tomatoes and basil, that we ordered as a starter. 
The staff was cheerful and attentive, so we left some tip too, as it was an pleasing dining experience.
Furthermore, the atmosphere was very relaxing, as great music was played.
This is a recommendation for people that are searching​ for a place to eat tasty with a keen price.
Excellent experience,excellent food!i couldn't stop eating that perfect pizza!

A good pizzeria, tradicional of Firenze. I passed a couple time here apreciating a good pizze. I could give more stars but it was the first impression of this place. Maybe  it ca diserve a second visite and taste another  types of the menu. But it is a good choice near the center.

I would give negative stars if I could! We had reservations for over 2 months and were very excited to be able to eat here. We were seated right as they opened and given bread but no plates. We waited almost 30 minutes and the waitor didn’t check on us at all!!! Every other table near us had gotten their dinners but the waiter couldn’t even bother to check on us. Absolutely the WORST service I’ve ever experienced. When we walked out because we could not stand to wait any longer, the management didn’t seem to care at all. It’s a shame this place was so disappointing, but I’ve never received such bad service and such a lack of care from a restaurant.

Omg.. what can i say about this beautiful restaurant! I have had one of my ultimate food experiences in this place! Amazing food, amazing atmosphere.. my family and I have literally tried everything even sweets and drinks! And don't get me started on the MEAT (Florentine).. just perfection! 
Totally recommend this place even if you're in Florence for just a day!
Lovely steak. If u don’t like rare Firenze-style steak, this is not the place. If you’re ok with rare steak, I strongly recommend!

Very disappointed. Booked our reservation months in advance and arrived to the restaurant 10 minutes early (before they opened). We were seated quickly and we got our water. The waiter did not return again so we decided to leave after almost 30 minutes. Everyone around us already had wine and appetizers, some even had their dinners. The waiter nor the managers really seemed to care. We were looking forward to this dinner for so long because we had heard such good things about the restaurant. Wish I could give it 0 stars.

Good food, a touch on the salty side.  I had the 40 Euro family style meal.  It was way too much food.  So much went to waste that you feel bad not eating it all.  Most tables ordered the Florentine steak for two and had similar issues.   The restaurant would be better with smaller portions.  But everything was tasty.
Busy lil great trattoria - can’t get enough! Florentine steak was amazing and I had visited during truffle season and they were so generous with it! Highly recommended!

The food is really tasty, no doubt about that, and the personnel forthcoming and polite. Also the atmosphere is quite nice inside the trattoria. I personally found it a bit too pricy and upscale though.

This was the most disappointing experience I had ever had! We made a reservation and we arrived 10 minutes before the arranged time. 
As a persons who works as culinary concept developer in Switzerland I would like to comment this next points: 
1. Welcoming- not existent. I had to go and ask the cashier if they have our table ready. She totally ignored me. The young guy preparing desserts helped me out and sayed I should wait a bit, our table would be ready in just a minute. 
2. Sitting- terrible! Even though we had a reservation, other people that came after us were sitted. I have to mention that the other persons had no reservation, they just happened to know the persons who was in charge of sitting. 
3. Personal: very unpolite! After waiting for around 30 min. having plenty of free ready tables in front of us, a very nice old man told us our table was ready and we should go at the lady in charge of sitting. Again total ignore from her side! The table indicated wasn’t ready at all and we were just sitting next to a table that was full of empty glasses and dirty disches. We decided to leave immediately!Very rude and unprofessional. For a restaurant with such a name this is unacceptable ! 
4. Athmosphere: crowded
5. Food: unfortunately I wasn’t given the chance to enjoy it. 
6. Suggestions: 
a) Get another extra person who should take care of the welcoming and waiting clients. b)Make a list with who is coming first and reservations. 
c) treat persons correctly and make no favors! Business is business! 
d) make a nice waiting corner outside the restaurant with cocktail tables were people can wait. Offer them something to drink from the house and appolagise for the long waiting time. (This is a win win situation for you and your business, for the clients who are already in the restaurant, for the waiting clients and for your name as one of the best restaurants in Florence)
I wouldn’t recommend this restaurant.
Thank you
The artichokes, the pasta with wild boar, the tagliata, and the cantucci and vinsanto sede superbike. One of the best meals of my life

This four generation trattoria is certainly one of the best in this dream city. It is an experience in a Florentine traditional temple. Now run by the granddaughter Chiara Massiero, it was founded by Cammillo, her grandfather, in 1945. Present almost every day, Chiara hosts her guests as if she is receiving them at her house. The main entrance room is the most historical and attractive part of the trattoria but also most challenging to find a table. It could get noisy but the charm is there. There are adjacent elegant rooms for more tranquil, romantic type meals. There is only compliments for the food because whatever you order is delicious. Pasta menu changes every day. I must have eaten the best pasta bottarga (fish eggs) al dente at Trattoria Cammillo. But you will certainly get one of the best Florentine steaks if you are up to a meat dish.The service is friendly and at its best. The wine list is rich. The other high class mark of this trattoria is that it is still one of the few left in Florence where impeccable white table cloths are not replaced by disgusting place mats.

To celebrate our last night in Florence, we decided to splurge a little and had dinner at the Hotel Baglioni's rooftop restaurant. We were guests of the hotel so were given a 15% discount  certificate which we happily used. Do make reservations. I cannot emphasize that more. A meal in Italy is an event and is never, nor should it be, rushed. This means there is really a low turnover rate for tables. So walking-in may be an exercise in futility. 
This is the same restaurant where we have our daily breakfast at the hotel. The daytime views were awesome but at night it was simply breathtaking. For dinner we had a few appetizers to share. For our main course, I had the duck which I thought was sublime. My companions shared the bisteca alla Fiorentina. The single order was huge so I got to taste it too. It was very tender and the beef flavors where enhanced by the sauce. They have a very expansive wine list. Dessert and cafe completed the meal and we spent the rest of the night marvelling at the views.
Nice cocktails bar on the Baglioni hotel rooftop. Great view, 360° to Florence, recommended.
reserve Table T1 & T2 is best place to see the firenze duomo.
Excellent views on the city. Nice food.

Food is amazing and this restaurant definitely has the best view of Florence. The service is gentle and very fast. You will never have to wait or even ask for anything. The food is fresh and heavenly tasting. Wow.

A very nice looking Cafe with lots of outdoor seating and attentive staff for our Sunday brunch in early April. 

Our coffee and wine were very good but we made the mistake of ordering lunch. €20 fish came out in a piece of aluminum foil and €14 roast beef sandwich was undercooked. Slightly diappointed and definitely overpriced  given the fodd quality.

One of the few totally original cafes in Florence. Usally packed with locals, expect very few spaces at the bar. Highest quality of produce as you would expect from the Cibreo family. Been there about 10 times.
It was an as fascinating experience. The ambient, the food, the service, all was excellent. Go for the meringue cake as dessert. it's delicious!
Great place to eat . They have a choice from gourmet to children pasta. Good atmosphere and nice ambiance
Four of us had a great late-night meal. The dishes were creative, tasty and unique.  Definitely hope to visit here another time.

The ice cream here is amazing! Is creamy and the flavors are strong. I highly recommend the Cherry flavor and lime flavor. You will probably find a queue here, but the waiting time is ok. . around 5,10 minutes. Totally worth it!

A nice place and one of the best ice cream I have ever eaten. Try Caramello by Gelateria dei Neri and also try some whipped cream on top! The stuff is very friendly and they can recommend what to try! Strongly recommend.
Delicious and open late! This became our spot in Florence for late night gelato. We would go there during the day but the line up is usually pretty long (but worth it if you want excellent gelato).
Rich decadent gelato. Balance two flavors together for the perfect treat!

Is this meant to be one of the best gelaterias in Florence? I'd say this is the worst I have had in this trip, consistency is poor and way to creamy, flavours are barely present. The place is busy and overrated, ther are plenty of other places to try, go there instead
What are the correct hours? I tried visiting twice, two different days a week, and it was closed both times. (I heard it's the best in town, though, so still going to give it 4 stars).

The staff could be a bit more cheerful. The gelato taste was average. Definitely not the best we had tried in Tuscany so far.
Cappuccino was plain.

AMAZING icecream and coffee and super friendly staff. Definitely my favourite icecream in Florence historical centre. My kids also had a jam tart and said it was great. Great experience. Recommended and hope to be back soon! 5🌟

The flavors arent the most creative, but this gelato is the real deal. Due to the simplicity of the flavors it is easy to combine them into your favorite combination. The quality is hard to beat, you can tell they use quality natural ingredients.
Try the 2E wine. Perfect complement to the greatest gelato. Nice people.
